concept.title: Managing Registered Apps
concept.abstract:
The Registered App detail page provides critical updates, custom scripts, and settings pages for apps available in the Marketplace.
In the Spark Framework app, click the Spark Admin tab to return the Dashboard. Extend the Apps menu item to view current configurations and available updates. If updates are available, then an Alert Badge displays in the sidebar nav:

conbody.p: New critical updates display a Count Badge on the related app in the sidebar nav indicating the number of updates available.
The alerts remain visible until the user either Activates or Dismisses the update. When an update is activated or dismissed the count in the sidebar nav is decremented by 1.

section.p: New updates have an action menu with two options: Activate or Dismiss. Clicking the Activate action returns the confirmation modal:

p.b: When an update is Active, there are no further actions available.

section.p: Users can navigate to the Custom Scripts section to run schedule jobs, reset settings, and install scripts in order to reset configurations. Please check with the Implementation team prior to running Custom Scripts.The Delete All Data script in the Charge app will delete all data for the objects within Charge. The Delete all Configurations script in the Charge app will delete all Business Groups and GL Accounts, in addition to custom configurations.
The Settings Pages section allows the user to control the settings for both the Spark and Charge managed packages:
Click on Settings to return the Spark Framework settings:

ul.li: Is Enabled - Check to enable Framework
Enable Async Rollups - All rollups will run in the Future context

section.p: Click on eBusiness User/Profile Preferences to set an organization's Default Account, Contact, and Accounting Preferences.
